result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd R. Schwingle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

No possession or consumption of alcohol. 

Submit to AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete 24- to 26-week domestic abuse education program and follow through with any recommendations.

Follow all rules and regulations set out by the agent.

Pay costs (can be paid from money that the defendant has posted as bond).

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay supervision fees to DOC.  Court costs including victim/witness, DNA and all other surcharges paid from the bond posted with the Clerk by the Defendant in matters previously pending.  Balance due to the Court is $0.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd R. Schwingle

defendant.name: Schwingle, Todd R.
defendant.address: 14420 County Highway M, Blue River, WI 53518

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Sentencing Hearing - 02/23/18

15CM200 and 15CM221. Defendant Todd R. Schwingle in court, in custody, with attorney John Chappell Orth. Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Sentencing after rev is for count 1 of 15CM200 and count 2 of 15CM221. Victim addresses the Court. Atty. Forehand notes agent's recommendation for 6 months jail on 15CM221 and 3 months concurrent on 15CM200. Forehand asks for 9 months jail in 15CM221 and 3 months jail consecutive in 15CM200, for total intent of 1 year jail. Atty. Orth addresses the Court; asks for 3 mo jail in 15CM221 and 30 days in 15CM200 consecutively. Def addresses the Court.

Court rules on sentences:

15CM221 - Count 2/criminal trespass - 9 months county jail

15CM200 - Count 1/violate harassment restraining order - 90 days, consecutive to 15CM221

Huber granted. Credit: 38 days, stipulated to by counsel.

Atty. Orth asks for 30-day stay of execution of sentence. Court denies the request. Atty. Orth asks the Court to consider change of Def's cash bond in pending case. Atty. Forehand argues against any reduction of bond. Court denies that request.

From Atty Forehand objecting to the case being heard on Feb. 14th. 

Judge's response
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 23, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
17CT3 and 17CT4/initial and motion hearings in 15CM200 and 15CM221.  Defendant Todd R. Schwingle in court with attorney John Chappell Orth. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Orth received the 17CT3 and 17CT4 complaints now in court.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Def stands mute for entry of NG pleas in those cases.  Status to be set.

15CM200 and 15CM221 - Court takes up the motion for a break from probation while def is out of the country on his honeymoon.  Court inquires re agent's input; contacts agent for phone appearance.  Agent D Popp, appearing by phone, provides his input.  ADA Forehand addresses the Court; opposes the request.  Atty. Orth addresses the Court in support of the defense's motion.  Def addresses the Court.  Def's finance' addresses the Court.  

Court rules:  notes probation violations and pending charges of both parties; request/motion denied.

Status in the 17CT3 and 4 cases set for 3/15 at 11.  ADA requests $500 sig bond in the 17CT3 case.  So ordered.
Motion hearing on January 31, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
to Modify Conditions of Probation
Request to seal cases - w/responses from judge

Defendant Todd R. Schwingle in court with attorney John Chappell Orth. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin for status in 15CM200, 15CM221, and 16CM13.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached a plea agreement whereby def will be pleading to count 1 in 15CM200 and counts 2 and 4 in 15CM221; remaining counts and case 16CM13 to be dismissed/read-in.  State is also motioning to revoke $2500.00 bond from the money that the def has posted.  Agreement calls for sentence to be withheld for 18 months probation with conditions of no drink, d.a. education class, AODA and any follow up.  Additionally, for count 4, def to serve 20 days jail.

Def pleads no contest to the three counts stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  15CM200 and count 2 of 15CM221 - 18 months probation.  Conditions:  no alcohol, aoda/follow through with recommendations, attend, pay for, and succ. complete 24 to 26-week d.a. program and follow any other rules/regs as set out by agent; pay costs.

Count 4 in 15CM221 - 20 days jail with huber.  Costs.  Also, forfeiture of $2500.  

Court grants 60 day stay of jail.

Def to report today for probation.

Counts 1 and 3 in 15CM221 and 16CM13 dismissed/read in.
Status conference on August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

4 cases called together:  In 15TR1845 (city case), Attorney John Chappell Orth appeared by phone means for Defendant Todd R Schwingle and Prosecuting Atty James J. Robb appeared for Richland Center, City of.  In 16CM13, 15CM221, and 15CM200, ADA Amy Forehand appears for the State; Atty. Orth appears on behalf of the Defendant.  Atty. Orth states that, as one of these matters involves an OWI, Defense asks for disposition in the fall, after the season for which def would have difficulties having an occupational license.  Atty. Robb states an objection to the cases remaining open this long.  Court notes that case has been pending since November; request to wait til fall for disposition denied.  All matters continued to June 1st at 10 - in-person appearances required.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference at 04-13-2016 03:30 pm

Atty. Forehand for State in 15CM221, 15CM200, and 16CM13; Atty. Robb as prosecutor for city in 15TR1845.  Atty. Stephen Mays appears for def in all matters.  Counsel request further status.  4/13 at 3:30 for status in all.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 03-02-2016 11:00 am

Attorney Stephen Mays (appearing for Atty. John Orth) by phone means for Defendant Todd R. Schwingle. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Todd R. Schwingle not in court.  16CM13/initial, 15TR1845/status on city OWI case (tracking with criminal matters), 15CM200/status, 15CM221/status.  All matters adj. to 3/2 at 11 when Atty. Mays or Orth next here.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

15CM221/initial, 15CM200/adjourned initial (set for 12/16, called this date), and 15TR1845/intake (city case; set for 12/17, called today).  Attorney Stephen Eric Mays in court for Defendant Todd R. Schwingle, noting that Atty. John Orth is the attorney of record. Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Todd R. Schwingle not in court; appearing via counsel's authorization.  In all three matters, Atty. Mays enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Status requested and set for 1/20 at 10.  Atty. Robb, present in court, states he does not object to city TR case tracking with the CM matters.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-16-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Todd R. Schwingle in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his right to counsel.  Def waives right to counsel for sole, limited purpose of receiving an offer from the state.  Court sets re-appearance date and instructs def to speak with prosecutor.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
